newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria group H1 oper prof up 13.6%.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria group H1 oper prof up 13.6%.

text.p: Bank Austria, the country's largest bank, said on Friday group operating profit jumped 13.6 percent to 2.63 billion schillings in the first half, adding it expects full-year earnings to surpass 1995 levels.

"The business success of the Bank Austria group in the first six months of 1996 leads us to expect that full year 1996 earnings will exceed the level of the previous year," the bank said in a statement.
In 1995, the group posted operating profit of 5.338 billion schillings and net profit of 2.587 billion schillings.

The bank said that although operating income slipped 1.36 percent in the first half of this year compared with the year-ago period, the group had managed to pare down operating expenses by 5.82 percent.
Net interest income rose 5.92 percent over the same period last year. The bank did not give absolute figures.
Bank Austria traced the improved operating profit to its financial services divisions, notably leasing, credit cards, and its subsidiary banks abroad.
